ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: The physical background of protein NMR.

The class starts with very basic quantum mechanics to explain NMR, with an extensive background of the theory behind NMR, and then into more application of the theory. I would absolutely recommend this class to another student. It was very useful and interesting.
The course is a little disorganized, but not a lot of work is needed throughout the semester. That said, if you take the time to process the notes, you will learn a lot about the theory of NMR.
I'd recommend it if you're going to be working with proteins in your research

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It helped me understand NMR background more.
The course was very good in solidifying the theory behind NMR and the application into different pulse sequences and other uses.
Not so much since my research focus more on the analysis, however understanding the background of NMR definitely help a lot.
I definitely know a lot more about the capabilities of NMR as well as its limitations as a spectroscopic technique of analysis after this course
